CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 13, 1962, pg. 6, reads: "Where Falling Bricks Hit Two - This is a two-photograph reproduction of the residence of Mrs. Lorraine Boggs, at 2305 Wyandotte St., Oakland, where falling bricks from a crumbling, next-door frame house have struck her and her teen-age daughter. At left (looking southwards) Mrs. Boggs stands between her sons, Dave and James, at the entrance to the dangerous and narrow land between the houses. The shot at the right was taken from the rear, and shows the crumbling chimney atop the ruin, from which the bricks are slowly falling.  Dale came charging through the danger lane as the camera clicked. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Lorraine Boggs standing with her two sons Dave or Dale and James, next to their home, with dilapidated frame house on left, 2305 Wyandotte Street, Oakland
